extendedIngredients.name: apple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 C Reed's Spiced Apple Brew (if you can't find this product, you could use a Ginger Ale)
metaInformation: (if you can't find this product, you could use a Ginger Ale)

extendedIngredients.name: fresh ginger
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 t fresh ginger, chopped very finely

extendedIngredients.name: sticky rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 sticky candies (make them yourself or use a store-bought sticky caramel candy)
metaInformation: (make them yourself or use a sticky caramel candy)

recipes.title: Spice Cupcakes with a Candy Center: Meet the Barrister

winePairing.pairingText: Cupcakes can be paired with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 19 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: Combine the soda and the vinegar.    Add in the sugar and the applesauce and mix well.    Add the vanilla extract and lemon juice.    Add in the ginger, flour, baking soda, and baking powder and mix until just incorporated.    Fill cupcake liners 3/4 full.    Drop a candy into each liner.    Bake at 350 F for about 20 minutes or until cupcakes bounce back when touched.

steps.step: Combine the soda and the vinegar.
Add in the sugar and the applesauce and mix well.
Add the vanilla extract and lemon juice.
Add in the ginger, flour, baking soda, and baking powder and mix until just incorporated.    Fill cupcake liners 3/4 full.    Drop a candy into each liner.
Bake at 350 F for about 20 minutes or until cupcakes bounce back when touched.
